column5: Please indicate your current country of residence

column20: If you have any additional comments, please write them down here.

column19: Robotic voice and “game like” options for Medical treatment

column18: Only when the "person" was looking up at the screen and checking what the vitals were.
column19: That everything was so stiff and happened so slow.
column20: I feel like it was the same video I watched twice. I don't know what the difference were

column19: It seemed cold, distanced, baby jjust lying there, the talk was robotic,

column18: sound og machines and comments made by parent
column19: I'm not that fluent in English. So using energy figuring out the mening of specific nursing related words. The toolbar popping up that you had to choose intervention from.
column20: Is there in the tool bar an option elated not to instrumental nursing, but to the humanistic aspect of nursing - like taking care of familie/relatives, etc.

column18: The way the camera was moving. The noise in the background.
column19: That I didn't know what my hands were doing. That the nurses and the father were just standing there, not acting much.
column20: I couldn't tell the difference between the first and the second so I had a worse sense of being in the room the second time because I got impatient.

column19: The choppy animations and somewhat the disconnect between graphics outside the window and graphics of the room
Being on a screen in my office
column20: i can see this is supposed to be a VR experience, if it was in VR I would have probably felt MUCH more immersed in the emergency room. Definitely would make for a great training experience.

column19: graphics, pull up screen floating hand
the discord between the movements in the vr and the movements of my self

column18: wearing a headset - having no outside stimuli

column19: The lacking and odd animations. (or lack thereof)
column20: Awesome prototype, but I fail to see any difference between the two videos.

column18: The sounds because they were really realistic.
column19: The voice of nurse, it sounded like SIRI, it made it very unrealistic.
column20: I did not get the differences of the videos? I could see the screen better, but if that was the only difference then it did not change the experience.

column18: Direct speech that fits the current situation

column19: Task were written on the table which was held i hands.
couldn't always see the vital signs
